title: Whole nation unanimous on Kashmir, Palestine issues: Qureshi
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 14 (APP): Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi Friday said that the whole nation including all the political parties of Pakistan had unanimity of views when it came the issues of Kashmir and Palestine.
In a telephonic conversation with Ameer of Jamat-e-Islami Sirajul Haq, who phoned him, the foreign minister said the whole Muslim Ummah was concerned over the aggression against the Palestinian worshipping Muslims during the Holy Ramazan.
Both the leaders discussed the Palestinian situation and Muslim unity besides condemning the ongoing Israeli aggression against the Palestinian people.
The foreign minister said Al-Aqsa Mosque was one of the holiest sites for Muslims as well as the first Qibla for them, so its protection was part of their faith.

Qureshi apprised the JI chief of the prime minister’s ongoing contacts with the international community to seek an end to ongoing aggression against Palestinians and seek peaceful resolution of the dispute.
The foreign minister said the Executive Committee of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) had convened the foreign ministerial level emergency meeting to devise a joint strategy on the Palestinian situation.
Qureshi said that he would also address the session via video link and apprise the participants of the concern and perturbation found among the Pakistan nation.
He also apprised Sirajul Haq of the diplomatic efforts made by Pakistan so far on the Palestine issue.
Sirajul Haq assured the foreign minister of Jamat-e-Islami’s all out cooperation on the Palestinian cause.
